FuncDef:
The mpls rsvp-te command in the MPLS view enables RSVP-TE globally. The mpls rsvp-te command in the interface view enables RSVP-TE on an interface.
The undo mpls rsvp-te command disables RSVP-TE. The command run in the MPLS view disables RSVP-TE on all interfaces.
This command varies in transport and router modes. For detailed differences, see Differences Between Commands in Transport and Router Modes. This topic describes the command configuration in router mode.
By default, RSVP-TE is disabled.
Examples: Warning: All the MPLS RSVP services will be deleted. Continue? [Y/N]:Y
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The mpls and mpls te commands must be run to enable MPLS and MPLS TE respectively before the mpls rsvp-te command is run.
Precautions
If the undo mpls rsvp-te command is run in the MPLS view, RSVP-TE is disabled globally. If the undo mpls te command is run in the interface view, RSVP-TE is disabled on the specified interface.
